title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 655.3 - Reimbursement for parallel processing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 655.3 - Reimbursement for parallel processing

State Regulations

Administrative expenditures related to the operation of
client eligibility systems which constitute parallel processing of the Welfare

Management System will not be reimbursable in any social services district. For
the purposes of this regulation, the activities of local social services
districts which may be construed to be "parallel processing" include, but are
not limited to, the following tasks: (a) preparation of a local equivalent
authorization document for each client transaction for input into a local
system; (b) pre-edit procedures and
document comparison to attempt system synchronization; (c) entry of data into a duplicative
system; (d) maintenance of paper
files to accommodate the local authorization system; and
(e) hardware and software maintenance costs
associated with duplicative systems. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
655.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
